div1.p: Lazear thanks her for the magazines she sent. He describes his average day.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 18, 1900
div1.p:
I was glad
to get your letter a
day or two ago.

Dear little Houston
must be very cute.
How I wish I could
see him. It was
certainly good of you
to take such good
case of him.

Mabel is probably, with
you now or at any rate
will be by the time
this reaches you.
I wish I could be
there too.

Thank you very much
for send the two
Centurys and the Book buyer.
I know I shall enjoy
reading them. It is
a great pleasure
to have these things
when one is off in the
wilderness. I read
every evening. In the
late afternoon I often go
down to the sea and
have a swim. The water
is very warm often too more
than the air which is a
very peculiar sensation, hard
to imagine until you have
fell it. It is the best form
of exercise we have here
I really see very little of the
military life. The post covers a
great deal of ground and headquarters
is a long way from us. Besides
most of the exercises take place early
in the morning when I am always
busy at my own work.

Please don't stop writing often
because Mabel has come.
